sense.name: the act of defecation
sense.examples: The rhinoceros took a dump in its cage. Cleanup staff walked behind the parade horses to tidy up after the animals' dumps.

sense.name: a site for depositing garbage, waste material
sense.examples: People have picnics at the Wellesley town dump. The government has ordered the cleanup of these toxic waste dumps. The nuclear waste dump is being planned for deep inside that mountain.

sense.name: digital data copied from a computer storage device
sense.examples: The system administrator made a dump of the month's database logs. The C program did a core dump which is 40MB in size. Mary told John to give her a brain dump from the meetings in New York. (metaphoric extension)

sense.name: a building for storing supplies
sense.examples: This building was a munitions dump in the 19th century.

sense.name: a dreary or rundown place
sense.examples: The restaurant looked like a dump so we decided to eat elsewhere. How can John live in such dump! She described the town she grew up in as a real dump.
